messages.message:
Couple of questions:
1. How sure are we that this is the best solution? I want to make sure this is what we're going with before starting building anything
2. Do you all think this would be useful to other customers too?
3. Which would release would we need to target for this?

1. @Matt Weaver will be best to advise. We just want an easy way for someone to upload documents to IB, without necessarily having an account and uploading an individual dock to the file system every time. 
2. I can ask the TAMs
3. Let me confirm
Just to clarify, this would still not allow people to upload documents without an account
OK - so they’d sign in and then upload, rather than navigate to the specific repo and upload?
I'm guessing their workflow would be to click on the submission link provided to them, log in when prompted, and then upload their documents

Feedback from Tams
1. Seems like this should be a great use case for underwriting. In case of a missing doc / incorrect doc - the UW could request the mortgage specialist (or in an advanced world the customer directly) for this document
@wadams - can you share how Gusto use it please!

Bit of a custom thing to them, but they wanted to let anyone at Gusto use IB for their new-customer onboarding process.  They created a custom web UI where users can upload documents.  If IB has a flow for that particular document type, everything is run through API calls and just spits the end result into their single source of truth, Better Onboarding Spread Sheet (BOSS)
@Matt Weaver this sounds v similar to what NatWest want!

Well let me know if this is definitely what is needed and I can add the upload feature and do a couple of tweaks to the app! I could possibly do the July release if needed but August release would be much better :ok_hand:
